title: Bookmarks folder change colour from grey to yellow
content:
I am using Firefox 103.0.2 and the bookmarks colours have changed from yellow to grey. I have tried the following solutions:

1. https://www.userchrome.org/what-is-userchrome-css.html - I downloaded the .css file and copied it in the chrome folder in my profile 2. toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets - I set the preference to true.

Is there any way I can make them look yellow again?
creator: anca.suciu

title: popups
content: Might there be a way of telling my Firefox to autoclose a specific popup on a specific site? There are half a dozen sites I use regularly that have ones that are useless to me but that use a method not caught by the standard "block pop-up windows" (yes, I have it enabled). It would be such a convenience, in particular when following news links around. And to default to "accept all cookies" on popups would also be very helpful (I enable the Clear history when Firefox closes option to reduce tracking). I've read about uBlock Origin: does it allow me to start my own list and add to it when I'm on a page that has the problem? And, doesn't 'blocking' have to tell the site? autoclosing wouldn't.

title: Bookmarks no longer work.

creator: dennish2

title: Mais uma atualização que piora demais o rendimento do próprio navegador
content: Depois de muito tempo sem conseguir solução para o navegador Mozilla estar comendo mais de 80% da memória, nesta madrugada após aceitar mais uma atualização que só pioram as coisas, o navegador Mozilla resolveu PARAR DE FUNCIONAR APÓS UMA ATUALIZAÇÃO. Simplesmente não funciona, você abre, ele trava, não aceita nenhum clique, não aceita nenhum comando, nada. Estou utilizando o Google Chrome com a página do suporte do Mozilla salva para conseguir relatar esta merda! Não é possível que toda atualização seja para piorar o desempenho do próprio navegador, é um tiro no pé, porra!!!! A falta de noção é absurda, eu não consigo utilizar o Mozilla para MERDA NENHUMA e agora ele resolve PARAR DE FUNCIONAR APÓS UMA ATUALIZAÇÃO. Vejam bem, vocês foram de atualizações que pioravam o rendimento do navegador até chegar num navegador que gasta mais de 80% da memória do meu computador e agora resolveram simplesmente NÃO FUNCIONAR EM NADA APÓS UMA ATUALIZAÇÃO. Ou seja, começaram piorando, resolveram piorar, pioraram, tiveram sucesso total na piora e agora simplesmente NÃO FUNCIONA NADA! NENHUM CLIQUE NO NAVEGADOR FUNCIONA. Sem salvar cookies, sem histórico, sem nada, como sempre! Sem extensões, sem downloads, sem nada. O fato de ATUALIZAR O NAVEGADOR MOZILLA e tentar utilizá-lo é o motivo central dele não funcionar. Como qualquer outro navegador, como o Google Chrome de onde escrevo esta reclamação, funciona a milhão, consumindo menos de 20% de memória e vocês além de consumirem mais de 80% pra não abrirem SE QUER UM SITE, agora resolveram APÓS MAIS UMA ATUALIZAÇÃO QUE NÃO SERVIU DE PORCARIA NENHUMA PRA NADA, não funcionar absolutamente em NADA, NENHUM CLIQUE!!! Eu tenho um ódio TOTALMENTE MORTAL A RESPEITO DE CADA DESENVOLVEDOR, PROGRAMADOR, EMPRESÁRIO, PUBLICITÁRIO E COMUNICADOR envolvido com este navegador MOZILLA! MEU DESEJO É QUE ACONTEÇA O PIOR PRA CADA UM!!! E QUE A MORTE NÃO SEJA O PIOR, VOCÊS TEM QUE SOFRER O MÁXIMO NECESSÁRIO PARA SE FODEREM O RESTO DA VIDA, CAMBADA DE FILHO DA PUTA!!!
creator: hugocarvalho.cs

title: How to disable autosave for bookmarks
content:
I have the option 'Show editor when saving' checked, so I'm getting the bookmark editor popup window when I want to save a bookmark .

However, more often than not, a bookmark is being saved without me clicking the Save button .

My understanding is that it's a feature of sorts, but it's driving me bonkers, and I just can't remember what I need to do to not save a bookmark - hit esc. , click the star button again, use the keyboard shortcut, or whatever it is . Nor do I care to be frank, I really just want Firefox to not save a bookmark without confirmation , which I thought would be the main point of having the optional editor window .

Is there any way to disable autosave for bookmarks completely ? Sorry about the rant, it's just so unintuitive and annoying, and I'm tired of cleaning out my bookmark folders all the time ...
creator: karlserer

title: Cloudflare client certificate does not work properly
content:
I have a client certificate from CLoudflare, on Android and Linux it always works (with Chrome). But I mostly use Linux with Firefox, and there it works sometimes and sometimes not :/

I have already deleted all data (cookies etc.), and used the private browser, has brought nothing.

The weird thing is that it works after a while. e.g. I start firefox in the morning and want to go to the corresponding page and it doesn't work, but when I do something else and try it again later it works, and when I do something else again (in firefox or other programs, it doesn't matter) it doesn't work again.

And it doesn't matter if I use the private browser or not.

I have also already replaced the certificate and I have tried a legacy pkcs12 certificate, all has done nothing

(All certificates were in pkcs12 format)

Does anyone have any idea what this can be?
creator: Pickl3s

title: Firefox Sync disconnects after every OS boot
content:
Hi,

I'm having a problem with Firefox Sync. When I started Firefox Sync it said disconnected, I logged in, exited the browser and reopened the browser and Firefox Sync was still working.

But when I shutdown, or restart the operating system, Firefox Sync gives an error that it has been disconnected, forcing me to log in again.

I have tried uninstalling, deleting all profiles in the %appdata% folder of the operating system and reinstalling but still the same error.

Hope someone will help me! Thank you!

title: Firefox loading some pages but not others?
content:
Internet is fine, other apps and browsers load fine. Mozilla support pages load fine, I'm sending this post through the affected Firefox. But every other page I try to load hangs endlessly. Youtube, FB, DuckDuckGo, reddit, just standalone images, literally nothing else seems to load.

I'd installed a mod loader for a game earlier that gave BitDefender a conniption fit I guess because of the way the loader injected code, and BD insisted on doing a "malware clean" on reboot after I told it not to. I suspect BD must have deleted something or changed permissions, but I can't find anything in its app that would undo or provide exceptions etc.

Is there any way to refresh/troubleshoot without having do a full reinstall? (or else an easier way to do a reinstall that's less of a hassle?) I've already rebooted my PC, restarted Firefox a couple times, emptied the cache and cookies, and tried to connect with no proxy, none so far have worked.

(Windows 10, Firefox v 103.0.2)
creator: midas_touch

title: Metro PCS
content:
So for the longest time I've had issues trying to load, "https://www.metrobyt-mobile.com" and all I get is:

The page isn’t redirecting properly

An error occurred during a connection to www.metrobyt-mobile.com. 

   This problem can sometimes be caused by disabling or refusing to accept cookies.

Works fine is all other browser, but Firefox. Even on a brand new laptop I bought I tried to load Metro site through Desktop Firefox and it always comes back with this issue. I've tried disabling everything that is recommended on the forum, but nothing helps, but as I stated, "Brand New Laptop." Which has a clean install of Windows with a clean install of Firefox in Incognito, no sign in, no extension, and still this is the only site that refuses to load for me. I've tried friends and family members Desktop to Laptops as well and same error.

So either Mozilla Firefox has an issue on all Desktops or I am seriously mission something. If it was a software conflict or something a clean Windows install shouldn't have this issue, but it does. I'm putting this out there to Mozilla to look into as to find out if it's an issue on my side, their side, or Metro PCS's side. Funny enough it works fine on the Mozilla Firefox App. I can run the app through Bluestacks and that loads fine on my desktop through an android emulator. It just seems to be Firefox on the Desktop side.

If I click on the little (i) Icon in the address bar it says, "Connection Failure." Clicking on that, "You are not securely connected to this site." If I clear the cookies I get a secure connection, but the just loads blank, no text or anything.
creator: wristan

title: Using Firefox with a VPN yields PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR
content:
Using Windows 11. I'm using a free Proton VPN. My Firefox version is 103.02. I want to be able to continue to use the VPN when using Firefox to check my gmail accounts. If I disconnect the VPN, Firefox lets me access my mail site without a problem. When I use the VPN connected, I'm getting a PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

Is there a way to keep the VPN on and connect with no error? Is there a Firefox setting I can change? I don't have proxy selected in Win 11 connections. Cache is cleared.
